definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: These clocks became the standard for global timekeeping.
sentences.chinese: 这些原子钟是全球计时的标准。

sentences.english: And an ytterbium clock has the potential to be even more accurate and stable than the cesium chronometer.
sentences.chinese: 镱原子钟甚至可能比铯原子钟更加精确和稳定。

sentences.english: And an ytterbium clock has the potential to be even more accurate and stable than the cesium chronometer.
sentences.chinese: 镱原子钟甚至可能比铯原子钟更加精确和稳定。

sentences.english: In a traditional atomic clock, atoms are illuminated by microwaves, in the gigahertz frequency range.
sentences.chinese: 在传统的原子钟里，原子受到吉赫波段的微波照射。

sentences.english: After 10 years of development, CSAC went on the market in January.
sentences.chinese: 经过十年的发展，原子钟于今年一月进入市场。

sentences.english: Scientists developed the first atomic clock in 1949.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们于1949年制作了第一台原子钟。

definition: neutrino (particle physics)/also written 微中子[wei1 zhong1 zi3]
